page.title: 12Peat cutting
page.content: Peats are cut during May and June. Peat cutting rights accompany the rent or ownership of the older houses and crofts.There are two ways of cutting peats:traditional and modern. The first stage of the older method is to line the bank.Then the turf is removed with a flachter or a converted horse plough pulled by a tractor.This is known locally as 'turring the bank' In a squad of 4 the peats are cut with a tusker-1 cuts,1 lifts the peat out,2 spread them to dry.In a dry year they are ready for'setting up'on edge in a herring bone pattern at 10-14 days. The newer method uses a J.C.B.equipped with 2 buckets.The ditching bucket removes the turf.The second bucket specially made for peat cutting cuts 12 peats at a time'a case of peats'The peats are then spread as before.When dry they are built in a stack at home.
